headline: Fourth-generation movie theater operator says he's months from bankruptcy
summary: B&B Theatres, the sixth largest cinema chain in the U.S., has been operating for nearly 100 years. Its owners say it is months away from bankruptcy.

headline: Google's new streaming TV gadget is a great alternative to Roku or Amazon Fire TV
summary: It's Google's first real rival to the Roku and Amazon Fire TV and comes with a remote and really good Google TV software.

headline: Microsoft implements new 'hybrid' remote work policy, with option to work from home less than 50% of the time
summary: Microsoft employees have the option to work remotely full time with manager approval.

headline: Cramer says the stock market does not reflect Americansâ€™ need for more coronavirus stimulus
summary: "There isn't a Republican or Democrat that doesn't know someone who has been laid off or about to be laid off, frankly," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.
Finding health insurance can be stressful and confusing. But it's important to start looking as soon as possible if you lost it, and more than 6 million Americans are in that position.
headline: Lost your job and health insurance? Here is what you need to know

summary: To make your money last, experts recommend taking out around 4% of your nest egg per year in retirement. Here's how much spending money you'll have if you retire with $3 million.
headline: Here's what your monthly budget will look like if you retire with $3 million
With $3 billion on the line, expect NFL games to continue despite Covid-19 outbreak
summary: The NFL continues to see increased Covid-19 positive cases among players and staff forcing the league to tighten its protocols, issuing fines to players and staff.
A "great rebalancing" of investor portfolios away from core government bonds and a "coupon clipping environment" for markets are coming, according to HSBC Global Asset Management.
headline: HSBC calls start of a 'great rebalancing' as the global economy enters a flatter stage of the recovery
Broadway to remain closed through May 30
summary: The Broadway League, a trade organization representing producers and theater owners, announced Friday that Broadway's 41 theaters will remain closed through at least May 30.
The arena development firm said it's spending $2 million on technology that will clean air in the UBS Arena opens, which opens in November 2021.
headline: New York Islanders, Oak View Group want virus-killing air systems in new UBS Arena

summary: Small caps are rallying, but the charts suggest investors should sell the bounce, trader Mark Newton told CNBC.
headline: Four charts can explain the small-cap surge and signal what investors should do

summary: Gilead will have enough global supply of its coronavirus treatment remdesivir by the end of October, CEO Daniel O'Day told CNBC on Friday.
headline: Gilead CEO: 'We have ample supply' of remdesivir for hospitalized coronavirus patients

summary: IBM is going all-in on the cloud, and John Petrides of Tocqueville Asset Management said it's about to undergo a Microsoft-type transformation.
headline: One of the cheapest tech stocks is going through a transformative period, market analyst says

summary: Dow futures advanced Friday as investors sought clarity around whether another round of coronavirus stimulus was still possible.
headline: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Friday

summary: The number of mortgages in active pandemic-related bailouts plunged as the first wave of forbearance plans hit the end of their six-month term.
headline: Coronavirus mortgage bailouts fall below 3 million in pandemic's sharpest decline
Traders are confused by the stimulus back-and-forth and have their doubts about the market gains
summary: "The action over the last couple weeks is baking a lot of positive news into the market," Jack Miller, head of trading at Baird, said.
